explanation: [0-0] On a sunny outdoor lawn, a man in a blue short-sleeved shirt and black shorts, wearing pink eye mask, is holding a black inflatable hammer in both hands. In front of him is a cardboard with two round holes. A little girl in a white top, pink overalls, and white shoes, with her hair in pigtails, is squatting under the cardboard, looking up at the man in the blue shirt. Some green trees and buildings can be seen in the distance.

[0-10] First, the man in the blue shirt waves the inflatable hammer left and right over the two round holes, then stops with the hammer above the left hole. The little girl in the white top stands under the right hole. The man keeps hitting the left hole with the hammer. The little girl laughs and sticks her head out of the right hole, turning to look at the man. The man stops hammering, moves his eye mask away with his left hand, and looks at the little girl. The scene cuts to a close-up of the little girl in the white top, sticking out her tongue and rubbing two fingers on her cheeks.

[10-18] The scene then switches to a woman in a purple short-sleeved shirt and white shorts, holding an inflatable hammer in her right hand. She is wearing an eye mask and wiggles a few fingers with her left hand. The little girl in the white top faces forward and stands under the right hole. The woman in the purple shirt hits the little girl on the head a few times with the hammer. The little girl laughs, raises her right hand to cover her head, and turns to look at the woman. The woman in the purple shirt moves her eye mask to her forehead with her left hand, opens her mouth, leans down and sticks her tongue out at the little girl a few times. Finally, they both laugh and look ahead.
